verses.roman:
prati-rome prasveda paḍe rudhirera dhāra
kaṇṭhe gharghara, nāhi varṇera uccāra

synonyms: prati-rome—from each hair; prasveda—sweat; paḍe—drops; rudhirera—of blood; dhāra—flow; kaṇṭhe—in the throat; gharghara—gargling sound; nāhi—not; varṇera—of letters; uccāra—pronunciation.
translation: Blood and perspiration flowed incessantly from every pore of His body, and He could not speak a word but simply produced a gargling sound within His throat.
